required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Safety and Efficacy of Estetrol in Postmenopausal Women With Advanced Estrogen Receptor Positive (ER+) Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Clinical Trial Assessing Safety and Efficacy of Estetrol (E4) in Postmenopausal Women With Advanced Estrogen Receptor Positive (ER+) Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, open-label, phase I/IIa trial, dose-escalation study with a 3 + 3 cohort design to determine the recommended dose of estetrol for the treatment of patients with advanced breast cancer. After completing phase I part of the study (i.e. 4 weeks of treatment), patients will receive further treatment for 8 weeks at their individual phase I dose level (phase IIa part of the study).

primary_outcome.measure: The number of patients with a dose limiting toxicity (DLT)

secondary_outcome.description: Quality of Life will be assessed by means of a questionnaire on estrogen deficiency symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Preliminary anti-tumour response according to RECIST 1.1

other_outcome.measure: Number of patients with Adverse Events (AEs)

intervention.description: Estetrol formulated in tablets, in escalating doses, will be investigated in patients with estrogen receptor positive (ER+) locally advanced or metastatic breast cancer.

results_reference.citation: Singer CF, Bennink HJ, Natter C, Steurer S, Rudas M, Moinfar F, Appels N, Visser M, Kubista E. Antiestrogenic effects of the fetal estrogen estetrol in women with estrogen-receptor positive early breast cancer. Carcinogenesis. 2014 Nov;35(11):2447-51. doi: 10.1093/carcin/bgu144. Epub 2014 Jul 5.

Visser M, Kloosterboer HJ, Bennink HJ. Estetrol prevents and suppresses mammary tumors induced by DMBA in a rat model. Horm Mol Biol Clin Investig. 2012 Apr 1;9(1):95-103. doi: 10.1515/hmbci-2012-0015.
